what: Checking whether an R output is really nice — check
title: Checking whether an R output is really nice — check
text: Checking whether R output really nice

title: Checking whether an R output is really nice — check
Checking whether an R output is really nice — check
text: x R object. Can list vector, values can type numeric, double, character.

title: Checking whether an R output is really nice — check
code: x <- 23 * 3 check(x) #> [1] "Nice!"  x <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5) check(x) #> [1] "Not very nice."  x <- c("ten", "twenty", "thirty", "sixty nine") check(x) #> [1] "Nice!"

what: Checking whether any values in a data frame are nice — check_df
title: Checking whether any values in a data frame are nice — check_df
text: Checking whether values data frame nice

title: Checking whether any values in a data frame are nice — check_df
Checking whether any values in a data frame are nice — check_df
text: data data frame (can data.frame, tibble, data.table)

title: Checking whether any values in a data frame are nice — check_df
code: df <- data.frame(a = c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6), b = c(10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 69)) check_df(df) #> [1] "Nice!"  df <- data.frame(a = c(1, 2, 3), b = c("ten", "twenty", "sixty nine")) check_df(df) #> [1] "Nice!"
